background: NespelemCreek on the Colville Reservation are regularly planted with fish from the Colville Tribal Hatchery. The Hatchery Program has instituted a program of surveying Nespelem Creek30and 60 days after stocking. This is done to prevent any introgression of any native stocks that may be present and to stock in the most efficient manner. This program has been effective in increasing the efficiency of the Hatchery Program.
title: Resident Fish Stream Monitoring on CCT Reservation
assumptions:
Stream surveys accurately measure the number and species of fish present.

Survey responses from voluntary creel boxes are representative of overall angler catch rates.
objectives: Determine presence/absence of trout 30 and 60 days after stocking.
Determine catch rates of anglers in stocked waters.
The goal of our stream stocking is to increase numbers of catchable size rainbow trout for angler harvest up to 30 days post-stocking.
